articles.name: Planning and Prioritization
articles.description: Local Access Scores can inform complete streets prioritization plans or pedestrian and bike plans by identifying locations in need of improvement.

articles.name: Pedestrian & Bike Assessments
articles.description: Field investigation or documentation of local pedestrian conditions should focus on high-utility roadway segments likely to be used by the largest number of local residents.

articles.name: Maintenance & Enforcement
articles.description: Local Access scores can be used to inform operational plans for snow clearance, vegetation management, or routine repair.

articles.name: Project Selection
articles.description: Local Access scores can be used to screen the projects & possibly eliminate those likely to serve a relatively small number of users.

articles.name: Wayfinding
articles.description: Wayfinding programs can use the data to place signs where many people will pass, or at key intersections where walkers might be redirected to a recommended pedestrian route

articles.name: Pedestrian Counts & Performance Measurement
articles.description: Local Access utility scores can be used to identify groupings of count locations that are representative of an entire municipality or study area.
